newsitem.title: USA: Braun's June same-store sales up 15 pct.
newsitem.headline: Braun's June same-store sales up 15 pct.

text.p: Braun's Fashions Corp said same-store sales for the four-week period ended June 28 were up 15 percent.
Year-to-date, for the four months ended June 28, same-store sales increased 18 percent, the company said.
Braun's said sales for the four-week period totaled $6.7 million compared with $6.9 million in the same period a year-ago, despite operating 51 fewer stores.
As of June 28, Braun's operated 170 stores, compared to 221 stores at June 29, 1996.
Year-to-date, for the four months ended June 28, Braun's sales were $28.5 million compared with $28.4 million for last year's four-month period.

Chief executive Nicholas Cook said, "I am very pleased with our performance in June considering the unseasonably cool weather early in the month. Knits, sweaters and shorts performed particularly well."
Braun's sells women's clothing and accessories.
